page.title: 15Flower Festival, Eaglesfield
page.content: At{St Philip's Church,}a{flower {festival}was held between{25th}and {28th May.}Every window had a different scene.The porch had a hamper with flowers from the garden in it and stone boots with blue bells and greenery.I liked where the flowers had been arranged as if they were falling out of the font. At the ends of the pews were little circles of flowers . The altar flowers were red and white and represented{Pentecost.}At the side wild blooms were the{Quaker's}flowers. Beside that was a{hunting scene.}A fox and a mink, a group of carved walking sticks and a huntsman's coat were in the corner.There was a{farming arrangement and,at the back of the church was{'Great Grandma's Kitchen'. On the window opposite the door,the theme was{John Dalton.}The best display was about{Pitcairn Island.
